metadata.title: CVE-2023-32250 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP commands. The issue results from the lack of properlocking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leveragethis vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
